TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlLanguage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a language tag for use in XAML markup.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The language tag may or may not have a registered present on the system where the XAML is interpreted. This class is useful for dealing with values represented using `xml:lang` in XML. Language tags can be specified in two-character form or in a hyphenated language-locale form. See [RFC 3066](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=132454). Note that the XML specification allows the empty string for `xml:lang`, although that is not permitted by RFC 3066; therefore, the type permits "" (empty attribute string). A default-constructed behaves as if constructed with "" (empty string). ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *prefix* Language prefix, using the ISO 639-1 language prefix values. For example "en", or "zh". Uppercase values are accepted and converted to lowercase. This may also be an empty attribute, "". *subcode* If provided, must be preceded by a single hyphen. Then, a subcode as defined by RFC 3066. The most typical usage, and the one which is most likely to properly map to a , is a country or regional designation such as "-us" or "-hk". Uppercase values are accepted and converted to lowercase.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Empty As XmlLanguage
public: static property System::Windows::Markup::XmlLanguage ^ Empty { System::Windows::Markup::XmlLanguage ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a static instance as would be created by with the language tag as an empty attribute string.
Docs.value: The empty language tag version of , for use in comparison operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is in effect the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage> corresponding to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType>, whose <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.GetEquivalentCulture%2A> result is <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Globalization.CultureInfo GetEquivalentCulture() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the appropriate equivalent for this , if and only if such a is registered for the value of this
Docs.returns: A that can be used for localization-globalization API calls that take that type as an argument.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no equivalent <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> can be produced, this method raises an exception. If you do not wish to handle exceptions, call <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.GetSpecificCulture%2A> instead.

Docs.exception: No registered for the provided exists, as determined by a call to .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage GetLanguage(string ietfLanguageTag) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetLanguage (ietfLanguageTag As String) As XmlLanguage

Docs.param: An RFC 3066 language string, or empty string.
Docs.summary: Returns a instance, based on a string representing the language per RFC 3066.
Docs.returns: A new with the provided string as its value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is effectively the constructor.
The language string may be empty, or else must conform to [RFC 3066](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=132454) rules:
- The first subtag must consist of only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ascii](~/includes/tlasharptla-ascii-md.md)] letters.
- Additional subtags must consist [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ascii](~/includes/tlasharptla-ascii-md.md)] letters or numerals.
- Subtags are separated by a single hyphen character.
- Every subtag must be 1 to 8 characters long.
- No leading or trailing hyphens are permitted.

Docs.exception: parameter was non-empty, but did not conform to the syntax specified in RFC 3066.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Globalization.CultureInfo GetSpecificCulture() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the most-closely-related non-neutral for this .
Docs.returns: A that can be used for localization-globalization [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api](~/includes/tla2sharptla-api-md.md)] calls that take that type as an argument.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage> is equal to <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.Empty%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> then this method will return <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
This method finds the registered <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> matching the longest-possible prefix of this <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage>. If that registered <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> is neutral (<xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.IsNeutralCulture%2A> is `true`), then this method relies on a call to <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CreateSpecificCulture%2A> to map from a neutral <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> to a specific one.

Docs.exception: No related non-neutral is registered for the current .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IetfLanguageTag As String
public: property System::String ^ IetfLanguageTag { System::String ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the string representation of the language tag.
Docs.value: The string representation of the language tag.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property may return a normalized version of the originally-specified string as provided to <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.GetLanguage%2A>.
This property may also return <xref:System.String.Empty> if an empty string was provided to <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XmlLanguage.GetLanguage%2A>.
